snippet: Stricter enforcement of laws on foreign workers raises fears of hardship in countries like Egypt and Yemen, which rely on remittances from its workers in Saudi Arabia.
abstract: Saudi officials reverse course and announce three-month grace period for foreign workers; Saudi Arabia had started deporting thousands of foreign workers in crackdown that drew protests from local business owners and foreign diplomats.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH
byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: Stricter enforcement of laws on foreign workers raises fears of hardship in countries like Egypt and Yemen, which rely on remittances from its workers in Saudi Arabia.

headline.seo: Saudis Delay Measure Affecting Foreign Workers
headline.main: Saudis to Delay a Measure Deporting Foreign Workers
headline.print_headline: Saudis to Delay a Measure Deporting Foreign Workers
